newsitem.title: UKRAINE: US firm to start Ukraine depository certificates.
newsitem.headline: US firm to start Ukraine depository certificates.

text.p: U.S. firm Ladenburg Thalmann International Ltd will begin issuing Ukrainian Depository Certificates (UDC) covering Ukrainian equities in September, the head of the Ukraine branch said on Friday.

"The UDCs will make it easy for large institutional investors to buy shares on the Ukrainian market without having to experience current settlement problems," said Joseph Kolb, chief executive of Ladenberg Thalmann Ukrainian Securities LLC.

Kolb told Reuters the over-the-counter certificates, modelled on Russian Depository Certificates (RDC) launched by Western investment banks in 1995, would be made available on shares of 15 Ukrainian companies.
Companies which have started trading on Ukraine's embryonic stock market expect development of clearing and settlement centres and a depository within a year.
Kolb said UDCs would eventually be convertible to American Depository Receipts (ADRs), not possible under existing rules.
The firm would begin trading in Ukrainian equities and fixed-income securities next month, and planned to begin an index of the top 50 Ukrainian companies by September, Kolb added.

Bank Societe Generale Ukraine, whose sub-group SGEAN-London recently launched the $50 million Socgen Ladenburg Unveil Ukraine Fund, will serve as custodian for Ukrainian shares against which UDCs will be issued.
